title: LLMs as Workers in Human-Computational Algorithms? Replicating Crowdsourcing Pipelines with LLMs
description: We study whether large language models (LLMs) have the capacity to replicate human behavior in complex crowdsourcing pipelines.

title: Delphi: Towards Machine Ethics and Norms
description: We perform an initial exploration on modeling peopleâ€™s moral judgments on a variety of everyday situations to create more ethical, socially responsible AI.

title: Interpreting Hate Speech Classifiers: Does Dataset Label Space Matter?
description: We use machine learning interpretability methods to understand how hate speech classifiers make decisions and whether the dataset label space influences such decisions.

title: Visual COMET: Visual Commonsense Reasoning in Time
description: I developed a research demo for Visual COMET to make visual commonsense inferences on images for events before, during, and after the image.
